brief_description: TH2 cell differentiation was investigated by measuring IL-4 output after OVA plus papain challenge in normal and dendritic-cell depleted mice. The role of migrating dermal dendritic cells in OVA plus papain challenge by blocking migration and depleting dendritic cell subtypes.
brief_title: Dendritic cells and TH2 differentiation in vivo
condition_studied: TH2 cell response to challenge with OVA and papain
description: TH2 cell differentiation was investigated by measuring IL-4 output after OVA plus papain challenge in normal and dendritic-cell depleted mice. The role of migrating dermal dendritic cells in OVA plus papain challenge by blocking migration and depleting dendritic cell subtypes.
hypothesis: Dermal dendritic cells are required for TH2 cell response to OVA plus papain challenge. Dermal dendritic cells migate to the draining lymph node to initiate adaptive immune response.
objectives: To investigate the role of dendritic cells in TH2 response to OVA plus papain challenge.
official_title: Dendritic cells and TH2 differentiation in vivo
